lines.text: Maybe... the idea was to add heat to make the <c=#0000FF>Stop Wizard's</c> shell dry on faster.
Yeah- it was liquid concrete, right? So to make sure it set quickly, he cooked it a bit.
...Uh. Maybe, but this level of destruction's a little excessive for-
Wait, no. The <c=#FF0000>Go Wizard</c> got shot before the fire got big enough to trip the alarm.
Why would he be workin' on a disguise like that while Slick was in the room?
...Leavin' aside why he'd be workin' on that at all.
Um... hm, yeah, the timeline doesn't really match up, does it?
If he burnt... himself to a crisp, then maybe he'd look exactly like the statue.
And that way... Slick would think there were just two statues in here!
There's the level where it makes sense for someone to immolate themselves as a disguise...
There's the level where the statue could've existed before there was a fire to make <c=#0000FF>Flesh to Stone</c> backfire...
There's the level where Slick wasn't right there watching it happen and so could've totally been fooled...
Honestly, this theory is completely bulletproof. I won't hear a word against it!
In the interest of thoroughness, though, how about we come up with some other ideas?
Yeah, some implausible what-ifs to support my rock-solid deduction. Good idea.
